messages.subject: Contract delivery Golden Apples
messages.body:
Dear Sir,


I was informed thru a business partner that you are able to import a large quantity of Apples.


We are Apple producers from Romania and we have an outstsanding quality that we export to several countries over the world.


In case of interest, it will be my pleasure to make you an offer.


Best regards,


Franz Larzlo
CEO srl Apple Comro
messages.raw:
Frank Larzlo

Date: Tue, 28 Sep 2010 11:00:55 +0200
Subject: Contract delivery Golden Apples
To: psambens@live.fr

Dear Sir,

I was informed thru a business partner that you are able to import a large quantity of Apples.

We are Apple producers from Romania and we have an outstsanding quality that we export to several countries over the world.

In case of interest, it will be my pleasure to make you an offer.

Best regards,

Franz Larzlo
CEO srl Apple Comro

2010/10/8 PSAM GROUP LTD <psambens@live.fr>


Dear Sir,
With thanks to your sent email and the contents well noted.
We hereby confirm to you that we are interested to buy your appels,
Kindly send to us your full product list and price list on CIF and FOB to Cotonou sea port rep of Benin
We are waiting for your reply.
Best regards,
Mr Paul

2010/10/14 PSAM GROUP LTD <psambens@live.fr>


Dear Sir,


With thanks to your sent email.


We hereby confirm to have received same and we are making the necessary arrangements with the buyers to place your an official order.


You are therefire requested to confirm below.


a) Terms of payment?????????
b) Loading system in container and quantity.
c) Live experation date.
d) Cool room voltage that ywill convey the apples than to Benin
e) Confirm if you have supplied any apple to any company in benin or africa before?
g)What is your previous business experience in Africa?
h) Does the apples have all the needed exportation licence and documents from your country?


Thanks and best regards,
Mr Pa.
Tel: 00229-97070276.

Mr Paul

2010/10/14 PSAM GROUP LTD <psambens@live.fr>

Dear Sir,

With thanks to your sent email.

We hereby confirm to have received same and we are making the necessary arrangements with the buyers to place your an official order.

You are therefire requested to confirm below.

a) Terms of payment?????????
b) Loading system in container and quantity.
c) Live experation date.
d) Cool room voltage that ywill convey the apples than to Benin
e) Confirm if you have supplied any apple to any company in benin or africa before?
g)What is your previous business experience in Africa?
h) Does the apples have all the needed exportation licence and documents from your country?

Thanks and best regards,
Mr Pa.
Tel: 00229-97070276.

Pay attention, scam-o-kids, that license and those documents will cost something!

messages.body:
Dear Sir,
 
Below my answers to your questions:
 
a) Terms of payment?????????
 
100% in advance or Letter of Credit.

b) Loading system in container and quantity.
 
We load the goods by containers using the BLT loading system version 2010. The system consists of a prime mover truck (the "tractor") with an integral self-loading and unloading capability, a payload trailer (M1076), and demountable cargo beds, referred to as flatracks.
 
c) Live experation date.
 
Shelf life is different from expiration date; the former relates to food quality, the latter to food safety. A product that has passed its shelf life might still be safe, but quality is no longer guaranteed. In most food stores, shelf life is maximized by using stock rotation, which involves moving products with the earliest sell by date to the front of the shelf, meaning that most shoppers will pick them up first and so getting them out of the store. This is important, as some stores can be fined for selling out of date products, and most if not all will have to mark such products down as wasted, leading to a loss of profit. Our goods can be stored for 2 months.

d) Cool room voltage that ywill convey the apples than to Benin
 
Refrigeration is a process in which work is done to move heat from one location to another. Refrigeration has many applications these include but are not limited to; household refrigerators, industrial freezers, cryogenics, air conditioning, and heat pumps.
Cold is the absence of heat, hence in order to decrease a temperature, one "removes heat", rather than "adding cold." In order to satisfy the Second Law of Thermodynamics, some form of work must be performed to accomplish this. The work is traditionally done by mechanical work but can also be done by magnetism, laser or other means. We recomend to store at +4°C.

e) Confirm if you have supplied any apple to any company in benin or africa before?
 
Yes we did. As you may know, Africa is the world's second-largest and second most-populous continent, after Asia. At about 30.2 million km2 including adjacent islands, it covers 6% of the Earth's total surface area and 20.4% of the total land area. With a billion people in 61 territories, it accounts for about 14.72% of the world's human population. Such a market offers us a lot of sales possibilities.

g)What is your previous business experience in Africa?
 
Trade is the voluntary, often asymmetric, exchange of goods, services, or money. Trade is also called commerce or transaction. A mechanism that allows trade is called a market. The original form of trade was barter, the direct exchange of goods and services. This was a good experience for us.

h) Does the apples have all the needed exportation licence and documents from your country?
The apple is the pomaceous fruit of the apple tree, species Malus domestica in the rose family (Rosaceae), and is a perennial. It is one of the most widely cultivated tree fruits, and the most widely known of the many members of genus Malus that are used by humans.
There are more than 7,500 known cultivars of apples, resulting in a range of desired characteristics. Cultivars vary in their yield and the ultimate size of the tree, even when grown on the same rootstock.
We supply the documents listed below:
 
-Commercial Invoice
-Health Certificate
-Pesticide Analyze Document
-Certificate of origin
-Export Declaration
-Storage quality certifiate
-Non GMO attest
-Quality control certificate
-Packing List
-Bill of Lading
-Export Licence
 
I hope my answers are satisfactory to you.
 
If you have further questions, feel free to contact me at any moment.
 
Kind regards,
 
Franz Larzlo
messages.raw:
Frank Larzlo

The very detailed explanation about apples was just a copy/paste from wikipedia...I hope he spent 30 minutes reading it hehehe

 Dear Sir,
Thanks to your sent email and every of your answers well noted.
But kindly understand that we are going for a meeting with the buyers of the apples on Monday as to finalize on the quantity order to be placed.
Before then I will like you to clearify us on this question " HAVE YOU SUPPLIED APPLE TO BENIN BEFORE???
Secondly, you are advised to send to us the copies of the below documents which you said that your company do supply with.


 supply the documents listed below:


-Health Certificate
-Pesticide Analyze Document

Mr Paul

messages.body:
Dr. Mr Paul,


I am getting concerned about the delay of your reply.


Are you ok? I relly hope so.


Have heard about that terrible accident in Benin. I hope yu and your relatives are doing fine.


You know, I have been a victim of an accident myself so I understand how it feels.


Sir, please send me further instructions in order to conclude this deal.


Awaiting your urgent reply.


Kind regards,

 
Franz Larzlo
messages.raw:
Frank Larzlo

Date: Thu, 21 Oct 2010 13:43:19 +0200

Dr. Mr Paul,

I am getting concerned about the delay of your reply.

Are you ok? I relly hope so.

Have heard about that terrible accident in Benin. I hope yu and your relatives are doing fine.

You know, I have been a victim of an accident myself so I understand how it feels.

Sir, please send me further instructions in order to conclude this deal.

Awaiting your urgent reply.

Kind regards,

Franz Larzlo

There was no incident at all in Benin, it was just me saying non sense things and continued :-)

messages.body:
Dear  Franz,


We are not all that Okay.


The Incident affected one of our client.


We have concluded a meeting with the buying company and they have already confirmed that they are ready to buy and their order has been concluded.


But on Monday, they made us to understand that there are some documents that we musht provide from the Benin health authority for an approval of your products to Benin. We agreed with them that we will do this as to see that you complete the business with your company.


Yesterday, we contacted the Benin ministry of public health and sanitation to know how this can be done. They gave me the formalities and after that I discorvered that the cost is too much for me to bear as I do not have such amount with me right Now.


So I dont know if you can be of any assistance to this so that we can complete this and start the business.


Note, any money that is been spent on this will be deducted before you ship any goods and this will be done from my 1% agreement which I had with the buyer.


I tried my possible best to tell the buyer to do this, but they said that this will be a prove to them that I and your company is able to handel this business.


So confirm if you can be of any financial assistance right now.


The Health authority said that the cost for every documentation is Euro7550.50


Pls I have limited time to email do to other programs at hand.
 can you call me on telephone right now?


Mr Pa.
Tel: 00229-97070276.
messages.raw:
Mr Paul

He even said that one of his customers "suffered" under that hehehe.

 

 

 

 

 

Here we go...

From: PSAM GROUP LTD <psambens@live.fr>
Date: 2010/10/21

Dear Franz,

We are not all that Okay.

The Incident affected one of our client.

We have concluded a meeting with the buying company and they have already confirmed that they are ready to buy and their order has been concluded.

But on Monday, they made us to understand that there are some documents that we musht provide from the Benin health authority for an approval of your products to Benin. We agreed with them that we will do this as to see that you complete the business with your company.

Yesterday, we contacted the Benin ministry of public health and sanitation to know how this can be done. They gave me the formalities and after that I discorvered that the cost is too much for me to bear as I do not have such amount with me right Now.

So I dont know if you can be of any assistance to this so that we can complete this and start the business.

Note, any money that is been spent on this will be deducted before you ship any goods and this will be done from my 1% agreement which I had with the buyer.

I tried my possible best to tell the buyer to do this, but they said that this will be a prove to them that I and your company is able to handel this business.

So confirm if you can be of any financial assistance right now.

The Health authority said that the cost for every documentation is Euro7550.50

Pls I have limited time to email do to other programs at hand. can you call me on telephone right now?

Mr Pa.
Tel: 00229-97070276.

messages.subject: Re: Top Urgent
messages.body:
Dear Paul,


Glad to hearing you and I feel deeply sorry for what happened to your partner.


Regarding the support in documents, we suggest to share the cost with you, in 50% for each party. This means that we are ready to send you the sum of 3.775 Euro.


Please send us your pro forma invoice including all your bank details.


Also send us the contract. Itt need to be signed before we invest in this operation.


Best regards,

 
Franz Larzlo
messages.raw:
Frank Larzlo

Frank tries to be obliging.

Glad to hearing you and I feel deeply sorry for what happened to your partner.

Regarding the support in documents, we suggest to share the cost with you, in 50% for each party. This means that we are ready to send you the sum of 3.775 Euro.

Please send us your pro forma invoice including all your bank details.

Also send us the contract. Itt need to be signed before we invest in this operation.

Best regards,

Franz Larzlo

messages.body:
Paul...Paul...Paul...


Ok....


Listen, I don't know how to say that but I started to have some feelings for you since we have started to email each other...


I couldn't stop it...I am sorry...but I am in love with you dear Paul...


I want to be your woman, live with you in Benin. I can make you so happy...


Do you wanna try my sweet apple? It could be all yours Paul...


What will we do about this Paul? Do you have a problem with me being gay?
messages.raw:
Frank Larzlo

Here starts the love story between Franz and Mr. Paul:

Paul...Paul...Paul...

Ok....

Listen, I don't know how to say that but I started to have some feelings for you since we have started to email each other...

I couldn't stop it...I am sorry...but I am in love with you dear Paul...

I want to be your woman, live with you in Benin. I can make you so happy...

Do you wanna try my sweet apple? It could be all yours Paul...

What will we do about this Paul? Do you have a problem with me being gay?

messages.body:
2010/10/26 PSAM GROUP LTD <psambens@live.fr>


Dear Larnzo.
Thanks for your sent email and the contents well noted.


I am very much glad to have read through such a good email with such a nice suggestion.
You have make a nice request if we can live together in Benin. It is a good one.


But kindly understand that we must firstly finish one thing before we can go over to the second thing.
We should at least complete the first business transaction then after the business establishment, we can be able to move over to Love affair.
Although every woman needs a man and every man needs a woman as the english man will have it to say " every women has the need for a LOVER as the flower is in need of water. The principal issue now is for us to complete our transaction..Then we can switch over to any other thing.


Moreover, all this while we have been negociating this transaction, you have not disclosed your full contact informations to me eg, address, telephone number etc. 


Kindly let us complete the business and see what we can do together.
I will like to call you on telephone. Give me your telephone number.
Waiting for your reply.


Mr Pa.
Tel: 00229-97070276

Mr Paul

messages.body:
2010/10/26 PSAM GROUP LTD <psambens@live.fr>


Dear Franz Larzlo,
I got your email and your apology.
You should not be ashmed of yourself. Because you have the right to choose what you want.  I am not worried about it. You know that every body has what he want.


Now on the business line, I want to know how far you have gone in preparing the Invoice according to the Purchase order that we sent to you. Also about the contract copy you requested me to send to you and I did as you said last week end.


Also Franz Larzo, you know as I already informed you about the documentation issue that the buyer has requested me to get and when we discussed it, you agreed to help or assist me with 50%. Then you requested me to send to you an account for you to transfer your agreed 50%, I want to know how far you have gone to this. Have you done so and have you transfered the money? Confirm same.


We are very much willing to complete this transaction with you as you know that we are already behind time scheduled.
I will give you a call.


Best regards.
Mr Paul.
Tel: 00229-97070276.
messages.raw:
Mr Paul

I got your email and your apology.
You should not be ashmed of yourself. Because you have the right to choose what you want. I am not worried about it. You know that every body has what he want.

Now on the business line, I want to know how far you have gone in preparing the Invoice according to the Purchase order that we sent to you. Also about the contract copy you requested me to send to you and I did as you said last week end.

Also Franz Larzo, you know as I already informed you about the documentation issue that the buyer has requested me to get and when we discussed it, you agreed to help or assist me with 50%. Then you requested me to send to you an account for you to transfer your agreed 50%, I want to know how far you have gone to this. Have you done so and have you transfered the money? Confirm same.

We are very much willing to complete this transaction with you as you know that we are already behind time scheduled. I will give you a call.

Best regards.
Mr Paul.
Tel: 00229-97070276.

messages.body:
Dear Paul,


Before sending you our contract, I would like to specify some points.


Our apple is the pomaceous fruit of the apple tree, species Malus domestica in the rose family (Rosaceae) and is a perennial. It is one of the most widely cultivated tree fruits, and the most widely known of the many members of genus Malus that are used by humans.
The tree originated in Central Asia, where its wild ancestor is still found today. There are more than 7,500 known cultivars of apples, resulting in a range of desired characteristics. Cultivars vary in their yield and the ultimate size of the tree, even when grown on the same rootstock.


Regarding the contract, in law, a contract is a legally binding agreement between two or more parties which, if it contains the elements of a valid legal agreement, is enforceable by law or by binding arbitration. A legally enforceable contract is an exchange of promises with specific legal remedies for breach. These can include compensatory remedy, whereby the defaulting party is required to pay monies that would otherwise have been exchanged were the contract honoured, or an Equitable remedy such as Specific Performance, in which the person who entered into the contract is required to carry out the specific action they have reneged upon.
Agreement is said to be reached when an offer capable of immediate acceptance is met with a "mirror image" acceptance (i.e., an unqualified acceptance). 


The parties must have the necessary capacity to contract and the contract must not be either trifling, indeterminate, impossible, or illegal. Contract law is based on the principle expressed in the Latin phrase pacta sunt servanda (usually translated "agreements are to be kept", but more literally "pacts must be kept"). Breach of contract is recognized by the law and remedies can be provided.


As long as the good or service provided is legal, any oral agreement between two parties can constitute a binding legal contract. The practical limitation to this, however, is that generally only parties to a written agreement have material evidence (the written contract itself) to prove the actual terms uttered at the time the agreement was struck. In daily life, most contracts can be and are made orally, such as purchasing a book or a sandwich. Sometimes written contracts are required by either the parties, or by statutory law within various jurisdiction for certain types of agreement, for example when buying a house or land.
Contract law can be classified, as is habitual in civil law systems, as part of a general law of obligations (along with tort, unjust enrichment or restitution).


According to legal scholar Sir John William Salmond, a contract is "an agreement creating and defining the obligations between two or more parties".
As a means of economic ordering, contract relies on the notion of consensual exchange and has been extensively discussed in broader economic, sociological and anthropological terms (see "Contractual theory", below). In American English, the term extends beyond the legal meaning to encompass a broader category of agreements.


This article mainly concerns contract law in common law jurisdictions (approximately coincident with the English-speaking world and anywhere the British Empire once held sway). Common-law jurisdictions usually offer proceedings in the English language, which has become to an extent a lingua franca of international business. The common law retains a high degree of freedom of contract, with parties largely free to set their own terms, whereas civil-law systems typically apply certain over-arching principles to disputes arising out of contract (see, for example the French Civil Code). It is very common for businesses not located in common-law jurisdictions to opt in to the common law through a Choice of law clause.


However, contract is a form of economic ordering common throughout the world, and different rules apply in jurisdictions applying civil law (derived from Roman law principles), Islamic law, socialist legal systems, and customary or local law.


Awaiting your reply in order to proceed.


Best regards,

 
Franz Larzlo
messages.raw:
Frank Larzlo

More important knowledge!

Breach of contract is recognized by the law and remedies can be provided.

As long as the good or service provided is legal, any oral agreement between two parties can constitute a binding legal contract. The practical limitation to this, however, is that generally only parties to a written agreement have material evidence (the written contract itself) to prove the actual terms uttered at the time the agreement was struck. In daily life, most contracts can be and are made orally, such as purchasing a book or a sandwich. Sometimes written contracts are required by either the parties, or by statutory law within various jurisdiction for certain types of agreement, for example when buying a house[4] or land.
Contract law can be classified, as is habitual in civil law systems, as part of a general law of obligations (along with tort, unjust enrichment or restitution).

According to legal scholar Sir John William Salmond, a contract is "an agreement creating and defining the obligations between two or more parties".
As a means of economic ordering, contract relies on the notion of consensual exchange and has been extensively discussed in broader economic, sociological and anthropological terms (see "Contractual theory", below). In American English, the term extends beyond the legal meaning to encompass a broader category of agreements.

This article mainly concerns contract law in common law jurisdictions (approximately coincident with the English-speaking world and anywhere the British Empire once held sway). Common-law jurisdictions usually offer proceedings in the English language, which has become to an extent a lingua franca of international business. The common law retains a high degree of freedom of contract, with parties largely free to set their own terms, whereas civil-law systems typically apply certain over-arching principles to disputes arising out of contract (see, for example the French Civil Code). It is very common for businesses not located in common-law jurisdictions to opt in to the common law through a Choice of law clause.

However, contract is a form of economic ordering common throughout the world, and different rules apply in jurisdictions applying civil law (derived from Roman law principles), Islamic law, socialist legal systems, and customary or local law.

Awaiting your reply in order to proceed.

Best regards,

Franz Larzlo

Dear  Franz Larzlo.
With thanks to your sent email and explanations on what a contract is all about. 


Yes of a truth, your explanations has assured us of the fact that you and your company are in line with ligal business contract.
It was because of this that we stated every thing clearly in the contract and if you have taken time to go through the contract copy which we sent to you, you will understand that it was written in favour of both parties and in such a way that no party is written against.


Based on this, we hereby in collaboration with the buying company accepted all the terms and explanations that you had given in your email.
It shall be our good intention that we can now proceed with this transaction.


 Dear Franz Larzlo, Yesterday, I called the mobile and telephone numbers you gave to me and someone picked it and did not understand english at all. WHY??.? Also I sent a text massage to the same number and no reply yet. Can you explain.
We hope to hear from you.
Mr Paul

messages.body:
Dear Mr. Paul,


Yesterday we have transfered the sum of 3.500 Euro to you as 50% of the sum for the paper works.


The bank has just sent me a copy of the swift which is attached.


The money should reach your account during the next days.


Once you have received the payment, please list me the requested documents to be legalized. Next week you will receive from me the documents, contract and pro forma invoices.


Mr. Paul, I am puting my confidence in your hands because I have trust in you and you proved to be a honest and serrious person. Please do not desapoint us and let us move further thru this transaction.


Your comission and the value of the contract is much higher than only these 3.500 Euro.


Awaiting your soonest reply.


Kind regards,

 
Franz Larzlo

messages.subject: URGENT CONFIRMATION.
messages.body:
Dear Franz,


Good day.


How are you?


We want to know if you got the email that we sent to you yesterday?


This is to give you information based on our business relationship and to see that every thing works as planned in other for us to have a long lasting business together.


Moreover Dear Franz, I want you to kindly understand that the money which you sent has not be with the bank account of my friend.  This morning, my friend went to the Bank to check and to know if the money is already in his account.


He later came back and reported to me tha the money is yet to arrive. But still on a way to know why the money is yet to be credited, the bank assistance went through the SWIFT copy you sent and discorvered an error on the SWIFT CODE of the bank. In the SWIFT you sent your Bank wrote (FBBBJBJ) Where the correct one is ( FIBBBJBJ). But when he was discausing with the Bank assistance, they made him to understand that they are yet to get the information from their Corresponding bank. Therefore I am advising you to go back to your BANK and know from them the state and position of the money. You bank can now notify the corresponding Bank if there is need for changing or they will tell you if it can come to Benin Bank.


Nevertheless, there is no problem yet but we only wanted to give you this information so that you can be assured of the fact that we have not gotten the money yet.  Check with your bank and get back to me for more understanding in this transaction.


Finally, I am still waiting for those papers  requested from you. Yesterday I called your telephone number but you did not pick up my calls why???


Have a nice day.

 
Mr Paul
messages.raw:
Mr Paul

From: PSAM GROUP LTD <psambens@live.fr>.
Date: 2010/11/.
Subject: URGENT CONFIRMATION.

Dear Franz,

Good day.

How are you?

We want to know if you got the email that we sent to you yesterday?

This is to give you information based on our business relationship and to see that every thing works as planned in other for us to have a long lasting business together.

Moreover Dear Franz, I want you to kindly understand that the money which you sent has not be with the bank account of my friend. This morning, my friend went to the Bank to check and to know if the money is already in his account.

He later came back and reported to me tha the money is yet to arrive. But still on a way to know why the money is yet to be credited, the bank assistance went through the SWIFT copy you sent and discorvered an error on the SWIFT CODE of the bank. In the SWIFT you sent your Bank wrote (FBBBJBJ) Where the correct one is ( FIBBBJBJ). But when he was discausing with the Bank assistance, they made him to understand that they are yet to get the information from their Corresponding bank. Therefore I am advising you to go back to your BANK and know from them the state and position of the money. You bank can now notify the corresponding Bank if there is need for changing or they will tell you if it can come to Benin Bank.

Nevertheless, there is no problem yet but we only wanted to give you this information so that you can be assured of the fact that we have not gotten the money yet. Check with your bank and get back to me for more understanding in this transaction.

Finally, I am still waiting for those papers requested from you. Yesterday I called your telephone number but you did not pick up my calls why???

Have a nice day.

Mr Paul

messages.body:
Mr. Paul,


I have clearly followed your instructions for the bank tranfer.


Below a copy of what you have emailed me:


Financial Bank Benin.
BENEFICIAIRE: Okafor Nnanna .
IBAN: = BJ392005801000163000xxxxxxxx.
SWIFT CODE: FBBBxxx.
CORRESPONDENT: Commerzbank Frankfurt- Swift: COBADEFF


I have called my bank and you are right. The payment has returned because of the wrong swift information. Now we need to request a new payment.


We will do that later today, together with the pro forma invoices and contract.


Yesterday I was abroad so could not answer your call.


Best regards,

 
Franz
messages.raw:
Frank Larzlo

On the chance that "Okafor Nnanna" is some other innocent person who has been duped into acting as a 'cash checking' service, the account details and part of the name have been anonymized.

2010/11/3 PSAM GROUP LTD <psambens@live.fr>


Dear Me Franz Larzlo,


We are very much surperice for this kind of statement you made in you email.


We wounder wounder which kind of market situation that has lead you and your company to take such decissiion.


Mr Franz kindly think twise on what you have just said to have decidede to cancel a business that will fetch both of us a good profit in the future.


I am surprised and this has proved to me that you are not a good business man and that you are not the real company.Because when I called you both sent telephone numbers and send you a massange throuhg my mobile number, a different person altogther pickes the call and tell me that she is Ilona.


Well i have nothing to tell you than to say thank you for allowing me to misuse my head earned money to sign a contract with the buying company and to have spend my money to reneu my business documents because of you.


MAY THE GOOD GOD BE OUR GEORGE.

 
PAUL

messages.body:
Mr. PAUL,


You have never called me once I have no missed calls from you.


You probably dialled a wrong number once you also sent me wrong bank details.


Mr. Paul, I feel sorry for you about this situation.


Let me think about everything...I am in the middle of a divorce...do you know how it feels when a man cheats you? My man found another man and now here I am...alone...


Paul, we could be so happy....


Please give me another chance....


Franz

messages.subject: UNBELIEVEABLE. WHY ???
messages.body:
Dear Franz,
Why have you decided to send us a face swift copy???


My partners has just confirmed to my partner that there is no bank in Hungary with this name HUNGARIAN BANK PRIVATE COMPANY KFT even the swift code HUGXE2NUUU does not exist.


But the correct bank is  HUNGARIAN DEVELOPMENT BANK PLC with swift code HBIDHUHBXXX.
WHY ALL THIS PLAY?????????


I did not expect it from you. For you to convience me that you are not a scam person, be honest to your self.
I LOVE YOU BUT YOU ARE HUTTING ME.


PLEASE CALL ME TO EXPLAIN WHAT HAPPENED.


MR PAU.
00229-97070276.
messages.raw:
Mr Paul

Paul confesses his love, but too late... a month of trying to cheat Larzlo comes to naught
